intro: Acaena berteroana, commonly known as the New Zealand bramble, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its thorny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, spiky fruits. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Acaena berteroana is often found in coastal and subalpine regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
